text: Gypsum type (regular, Type X, mold-resistant, tile backer) matches location and submittals
Stud spacing, type, and gauge confirmed prior to boarding
Fasteners, corner beads, trims, and backing materials match approved schedule/spec
Wall framing inspected for plumb, alignment, and proper backing at openings and fixtures
Inspections (electrical, plumbing, firestopping) signed off before boarding
Fire/sound insulation and sealants installed prior to drywall closure
Boards installed with staggered vertical joints; horizontal joints centered on framing
Screws spaced correctly (typically 12" o.c. field / 8" o.c. edge unless otherwise specified)
No overdriven screws, excessive gaps, or damaged boards
Acoustic sealant applied at top/bottom plates and control joints (where required)
All joints taped and finished to specified level (e.g., Level 4 or 5 finish)
Control joints, corner beads, and reveals installed straight and clean
Compound sanding free from ridges, gouges, or scratches
Shaft wall, fire-rated walls, chase walls completed to UL/WH assembly details
Moisture-resistant boards used in wet areas per spec
Lead-lined, acoustic, or impact-resistant boards verified where required
Walls and ceilings visually inspected for level/plumb and uniformity
Closeout documents submitted (UL assembly IDs, mock-up approvals if required)
Surface ready for paint or finish without defects
